str2: Hated, hostile; subst: an enemy. From a primary echtho; hateful; usually as a noun, an adversary.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To collect, gather. From sun and lego in its original sense; to collect.
